title: Recognize Hypothermia Stages and Symptoms
brief: Identify the progressive stages of hypothermia by core body temperature and symptoms.
steps: Step 1: Watch for initial shivering when core temperature drops to 35.5Â°C (96Â°F).
Step 2: Monitor for uncontrollable shivering that interferes with self-care ability.
Step 3: At 35-32Â°C (95-90Â°F), look for sluggish thinking, irrational reasoning, and false feelings of warmth.
Step 4: At 32-30Â°C (90-86Â°F), expect muscle rigidity, unconsciousness, and barely detectable vital signs.
Step 5: Recognize that core temperatures below 25Â°C (77Â°F) are almost always fatal.
warnings: Hypothermia can be caused by general exposure or sudden wetting from falling into water or fuel spills.
False feelings of warmth are dangerous - victims may remove protective clothing.
Death is almost certain if core temperature falls below 25Â°C (77Â°F).
